intro: Gomphia angulata, commonly known as the angular gomphia, is a member of the Restionaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, forming in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Gomphia angulata is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
